INGREDIENTS: 

 • 2 raw bananas, peeled and diced
 • 1 teaspoon turmeric powder
 • 1 cup yogurt
 • 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder
 • 1/2 teaspoon chilli powder
 • salt to taste

 Ingredients to be ground: 
 • 2 green chilis
 • 1 teaspoon cumin seeds
 • 1 cup coconut, freshly grated

 Ingredients for the seasoning
 • 1 teaspoon of coconut oil
 • 1 teaspoon of cumin seeds
 • 1/2 teaspoon mustard seeds
 • 1/8 teaspoon fenugreek seeds or methi seeds
 • 2 red chillies, slit into two
 • 2 sprigs curry leaves

 METHOD: 
 1. In a saucepan or a pressure cooker, cook the banana pieces, turmeric powder, a few curry leaves and salt along with 1/4 cup of water until the bananas are soft. 
 2. Once done, open the cooker and stir in the yogurt and chili powder and keep this aside. 
 3. Next, grind the grated coconut along with green chillies and cumin seeds into a fine paste. 
 4. Add the ground coconut mixture to the raw banana and yogurt curry and bring the mixture to a boil in the saucepan or pressure cooker you cooked the raw bananas in. 
 5. While the Kaalan is coming to a boil, we will prepare the seasoning for the Kaalan. 
 6. Heat coconut oil in a small pan; add in the mustard seeds, cumin seeds, fenugreek seeds, curry leaves and red chilies. Allow them to roast and crackle on medium heat. 
 7. Once roasted pour the seasoning into the Kurukku Kaalan and stir till everything blends together well. 
 8. Turn off the heat and transfer the Kurruku Kaalan to a serving bowl and serving warm. 
 9. Serve the Kuruku Kaalan (Raw Bananas in Coconut Curry) along with steamed rice for a dinner or family sunday lunch. 

 Note: 
 Traditionally the coconut paste is fried in oil until it becomes thick and gets a roasted aroma. But in this recipe, I have not roasted the coconut, to keep it healthy and preventing excess saturated oil formation from the coconut.
